metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.
metadata.keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website

content.text: SQL ALTER TABLE Statement
SQL ALTER TABLE Statement
The ALTER TABLE statement is used to add, delete, or modify columns in an existing table.
content.html: The ALTER TABLE statement is used to add, delete, or modify columns in an existing table.

content.text: The ALTER TABLE statement is also used to add and drop various constraints on an existing table.
content.html: The ALTER TABLE statement is also used to add and drop various constraints on an existing table.

content.text: ALTER TABLE - ADD Column
To add a column in a table, use the following syntax:
content.html: To add a column in a table, use the following syntax:

syntaxHighlighting.text:
ALTER TABLE table_name
ADD column_name datatype;

content.code:
ALTER TABLE table_name
ADD column_name datatype;

syntax_highlighting.text:
ALTER TABLE table_name
ADD column_name datatype;

content.code_html:
ALTER TABLE table_name
ADD column_name datatype;

syntax_highlighting_data.text:
ALTER TABLE table_name
ADD column_name datatype;

content.text: The following SQL adds an "Email" column to the "Customers" table:
content.html: The following SQL adds an "Email" column to the "Customers" table:

content.code_html:
ALTER TABLE Customers
ADD Email varchar(255);

content.text: ALTER TABLE - DROP COLUMN
To delete a column in a table, use the following syntax (notice that some database systems don't allow deleting a column):
content.html: To delete a column in a table, use the following syntax (notice that some database systems don't allow deleting a column):

syntaxHighlighting.text:
ALTER TABLE table_name
DROP COLUMN column_name;

content.code:
ALTER TABLE table_name
DROP COLUMN column_name;

syntax_highlighting.text:
ALTER TABLE table_name
DROP COLUMN column_name;

content.code_html:
ALTER TABLE table_name
DROP COLUMN column_name;

syntax_highlighting_data.text:
ALTER TABLE table_name
DROP COLUMN column_name;

content.text: The following SQL deletes the "Email" column from the "Customers" table:
content.html: The following SQL deletes the "Email" column from the "Customers" table:

content.code_html:
ALTER TABLE Customers
DROP COLUMN Email;

content.text: ALTER TABLE - RENAME COLUMN
To rename a column in a table, use the following syntax:
content.html: To rename a column in a table, use the following syntax:

syntaxHighlighting.text:
ALTER TABLE table_name
  RENAME COLUMN old_name to new_name;

content.code:
ALTER TABLE table_name
RENAME COLUMN old_name to new_name;

syntax_highlighting.text:
ALTER TABLE table_name
  RENAME COLUMN old_name to new_name;

content.code_html:
ALTER TABLE table_name
RENAME COLUMN old_name to new_name;

syntax_highlighting_data.text:
ALTER TABLE table_name
  RENAME COLUMN old_name to new_name;

content.text: To rename a column in a table in SQL Server, use the following syntax:
content.html: To rename a column in a table in SQL Server, use the following syntax:

content.text: SQL Server:
content.html: SQL Server:

content.code_html: EXEC sp_rename 'table_name.old_name',  'new_name', 'COLUMN';

content.text: ALTER TABLE - ALTER/MODIFY DATATYPE
To change the data type of a column in a table, use the following syntax:
content.html: To change the data type of a column in a table, use the following syntax:

content.text: SQL Server / MS Access:
content.html: SQL Server / MS Access:

syntaxHighlighting.text:
ALTER TABLE table_name
ALTER COLUMN column_name datatype;

content.code:
ALTER TABLE table_name
ALTER COLUMN column_name datatype;

syntax_highlighting.text:
ALTER TABLE table_name
ALTER COLUMN column_name datatype;

content.code_html:
ALTER TABLE table_name
ALTER COLUMN column_name datatype;

syntax_highlighting_data.text:
ALTER TABLE table_name
ALTER COLUMN column_name datatype;

content.text: My SQL / Oracle (prior version 10G):
content.html: My SQL / Oracle (prior version 10G):

syntaxHighlighting.text:
ALTER TABLE table_name
MODIFY COLUMN column_name datatype;

content.code:
ALTER TABLE table_name
MODIFY COLUMN column_name datatype;

syntax_highlighting.text:
ALTER TABLE table_name
MODIFY COLUMN column_name datatype;

content.code_html:
ALTER TABLE table_name
MODIFY COLUMN column_name datatype;

syntax_highlighting_data.text:
ALTER TABLE table_name
MODIFY COLUMN column_name datatype;

content.text: Oracle 10G and later:
content.html: Oracle 10G and later:

syntaxHighlighting.text:
ALTER TABLE table_name
MODIFY column_name datatype;

content.code:
ALTER TABLE table_name
MODIFY column_name datatype;

syntax_highlighting.text:
ALTER TABLE table_name
MODIFY column_name datatype;

content.code_html:
ALTER TABLE table_name
MODIFY column_name datatype;

syntax_highlighting_data.text:
ALTER TABLE table_name
MODIFY column_name datatype;

content.text: SQL ALTER TABLE Example
Look at the "Persons" table:
content.html: Look at the "Persons" table:

content.text: Now we want to add a column named "DateOfBirth" in the "Persons" table.
content.html: Now we want to add a column named "DateOfBirth" in the "Persons" table.

content.text: We use the following SQL statement:
content.html: We use the following SQL statement:

syntaxHighlighting.text:
ALTER TABLE Persons
ADD DateOfBirth date;

content.code:
ALTER TABLE Persons
ADD DateOfBirth date;

syntax_highlighting.text:
ALTER TABLE Persons
ADD DateOfBirth date;

content.code_html:
ALTER TABLE Persons
ADD DateOfBirth date;

syntax_highlighting_data.text:
ALTER TABLE Persons
ADD DateOfBirth date;

content.text: Notice that the new column, "DateOfBirth", is of type date and is going to hold a date. The data type specifies what type of data the column can hold. For a complete reference of all the data types available in MS Access, MySQL, and SQL Server, go to our complete Data Types reference .
content.html: Notice that the new column, "DateOfBirth", is of type date and is going to hold a date. The data type specifies what type of data the column can hold. For a complete reference of all the data types available in MS Access, MySQL, and SQL Server, go to our complete Data Types reference.

content.text: The "Persons" table will now look like this:
content.html: The "Persons" table will now look like this:

content.text: Change Data Type Example
Now we want to change the data type of the column named "DateOfBirth" in the "Persons" table.
content.html: Now we want to change the data type of the column named "DateOfBirth" in the "Persons" table.

content.text: We use the following SQL statement:
content.html: We use the following SQL statement:

syntaxHighlighting.text:
ALTER TABLE Persons
ALTER COLUMN DateOfBirth year;

content.code:
ALTER TABLE Persons
ALTER COLUMN DateOfBirth year;

syntax_highlighting.text:
ALTER TABLE Persons
ALTER COLUMN DateOfBirth year;

content.code_html:
ALTER TABLE Persons
ALTER COLUMN DateOfBirth year;

syntax_highlighting_data.text:
ALTER TABLE Persons
ALTER COLUMN DateOfBirth year;

content.text: Notice that the "DateOfBirth" column is now of type year and is going to hold a year in a two- or four-digit format.
content.html: Notice that the "DateOfBirth" column is now of type year and is going to hold a year in a two- or four-digit format.

content.text: DROP COLUMN Example
Next, we want to delete the column named "DateOfBirth" in the "Persons" table.
content.html: Next, we want to delete the column named "DateOfBirth" in the "Persons" table.

content.text: We use the following SQL statement:
content.html: We use the following SQL statement:

syntaxHighlighting.text:
ALTER TABLE Persons
DROP COLUMN DateOfBirth;

content.code:
ALTER TABLE Persons
DROP COLUMN DateOfBirth;

syntax_highlighting.text:
ALTER TABLE Persons
DROP COLUMN DateOfBirth;

content.code_html:
ALTER TABLE Persons
DROP COLUMN DateOfBirth;

syntax_highlighting_data.text:
ALTER TABLE Persons
DROP COLUMN DateOfBirth;

content.text: The "Persons" table will now look like this:
content.html: The "Persons" table will now look like this:

content.text: Exercise ? What is this? Test your skills by answering a few questions about the topics of this page
Which SQL statement adds a new column named 'Email' to the 'Employees' table?
content.html: Which SQL statement adds a new column named 'Email' to the 'Employees' table?

metadata.question: Which SQL statement adds a new column named 'Email' to the 'Employees' table?

options.text: ALTER TABLE Employees ADD COLUMN Email varchar(255);
ALTER Employees ADD COLUMN Email varchar(255);
ALTER TABLE Employees ADD Email varchar(255);
MODIFY TABLE Employees ADD COLUMN Email varchar(255);

content.question: Which SQL statement adds a new column named 'Email' to the 'Employees' table?

options.text: ALTER TABLE Employees ADD COLUMN Email varchar(255);
ALTER Employees ADD COLUMN Email varchar(255);
ALTER TABLE Employees ADD Email varchar(255);
MODIFY TABLE Employees ADD COLUMN Email varchar(255);
